title: Upper Body Strength
notes: Bench press replaces seated dumbbell press due to neck sensitivity

items.name: Flat Dumbbell Bench Press
cues: Lie flat on bench with feet planted and dumbbells over chest
Lower slowly to chest, keeping elbows at ~45° angle
Press up powerfully without locking out
Brace core and retract shoulder blades
Avoid flaring elbows excessively

items.name: Chest-Supported Dumbbell Row
cues: Lie chest-down on an incline bench or propped bench
Pull dumbbells toward your lower ribs
Keep elbows close to body
Squeeze shoulder blades at the top
Lower with control

items.name: Incline Landmine Press (Simulated with Dumbbell)
cues: Kneel and press dumbbell upward at ~45°
Keep core engaged and torso stable
Avoid shrugging shoulder
Control both the press and return
Keep elbow tracking under wrist
items.notes: Complete all reps on one side, then switch sides (8-10 reps per side)

items.name: Alternating or Supinated Dumbbell Biceps Curl
cues: Stand tall with elbows tucked
Supinate (rotate palm up) as you curl
Avoid swinging or leaning
Squeeze at the top, lower under control
Keep shoulders down and back

items.name: Overhead Triceps Extension (Single DB or Ruck Plate)
cues: Hold weight overhead with both hands
Lower behind head with elbows facing forward
Extend arms fully without overextending
Brace core to protect low back
Avoid flaring elbows
items.notes: Can use 30 lb ruck plate or dumbbell

items.name: Pallof Press (with Ruck or Dumbbell)
cues: Press out straight from chest
Resist rotational pull
Brace core and glutes
Hold briefly at full extension
Return slowly with control
items.notes: Complete all reps on one side, then switch sides (10 reps per side)
